title: Course of Biostatistics
text:
Program

Descriptive statistics: frequency distribution, measures of location and variability, graphical representations
Introduction to inferential statistics
Introduction to suvival analysis



References
Elston, R.C., and William J. Basic biostatistics for geneticists and epidemiologists: A practical approach. John Wiley & Sons, 2008.
Agresti, A. Statistical Methods for the Social Sciences, eBook, Global Edition. 5th Edition. Pearson International Content, 2018. (Basic)
Cicchitelli, G, D’Urso, P, Minozzo, M. Statistics: Principles and Methods,  Pearson, 2021. (Intermediate)
Mood, A., Graybill, F. Boes, D.  Introduction to the Theory of Statistics. 3rd Edition, McGraw-Hill, New York. 1974. (Advanced)


(Tentative) Schedule
The lessons will be held via Google Meet sessions according to the following schedule:

Tuesday, April 2, 15.30-18.00
Monday, April 8, 15.30-18.00
Monday, April 15, 15.30-18.00

Monday, April 22, 15.30-18.00
Tuesday, April 30, 15.30-18.00
Monday, May 6, 15.30-18.00
Wednesday, May 8 15.30-18.00

Lecture 7: Statistical tests, Part 2: Wednesday, May 8
